info.title: Secret Server Rest API

delete.description: A deactivated secret is hidden from users who do not have a role containing the View Deleted Secrets permission. Secret Server uses these "soft deletes" to maintain the audit history for all data. However, deactivated secrets are still accessible by administrators (like a permanent Recycle Bin) to ensure that audit history is maintained and to support recovery. A user must have the "View Deleted Secrets" permission in addition to Owner permission on a secret to access the secret View page for a deleted secret. To permanently remove all information on a secret, use the "Erase Secret" function.

get.description: Search, filter, sort, and page secrets

parameters.name: filter.allowDoubleLocks
parameters.description: Whether to allow DoubleLocks as part of the search. True by default.

parameters.name: filter.doNotCalculateTotal
parameters.description: Whether to return the total number of secrets matching the filters. False by default. If false, the total can be retrieved separately by calling /v1/secrets/search-total with the same arguments used in the search.

parameters.name: filter.doubleLockId
parameters.description: Only include Secrets with this DoubleLock ID assigned in the search results.

parameters.name: filter.extendedFields
parameters.description: An array of names of Secret Template fields to return.  Only exposed fields can be returned.

parameters.name: filter.extendedTypeId
parameters.description: If not null, return only secrets matching the specified extended mapping type as defined on the secrets template.

parameters.name: filter.folderId
parameters.description: If not null, returns only secrets within the specified folder.

parameters.name: filter.hasLauncher
parameters.description: Whether to only return secrets with or without launchers. If null, returns secrets regardless of whether they have launchers.

parameters.name: filter.heartbeatStatus
parameters.description: If not null, returns only secrets with a certain heartbeat status.

parameters.name: filter.includeActive
parameters.description: Whether to include active secrets in results (when excluded equals true).

parameters.name: filter.includeInactive
parameters.description: Whether to include inactive secrets in results.

parameters.name: filter.includeRestricted
parameters.description: Whether to include restricted secrets in results. Restricted secrets are secrets that are DoubleLocked, require approval, or require a comment to view.

parameters.name: filter.includeSubFolders
parameters.description: Whether to include secrets in subfolders of the specified folder.

parameters.name: filter.isExactMatch
parameters.description: Whether to do an exact match of the search text or a partial match. If an exact match, the entire secret name, field value, or list option in a list field must match the search text.

parameters.name: filter.onlyRPCEnabled
parameters.description: Whether to only include secrets whose template has Remote Password Changing enabled.

parameters.name: filter.onlySharedWithMe
parameters.description: When true only Secrets where you are not the owner and the Secret was shared explicitly with your user id will be returned.

parameters.name: filter.passwordTypeIds
parameters.description: If not null, returns only secrets matching the specified password types.

parameters.name: filter.permissionRequired
parameters.description: Specify whether to filter by List, View, Edit, or Owner permission. Default is List.

parameters.name: filter.scope
parameters.description: Specify whether to search All, Recent, or Favorites

parameters.name: filter.searchField
parameters.description: If set, restricts the search to only match secrets where the value of the field specified by name contains the search text.

parameters.name: filter.searchFieldSlug
parameters.description: If set, restricts the search to only match secrets where the value of the field specified by the slug name contains the search text. This will override SearchField.

parameters.name: filter.searchText
parameters.description: The text to match in the secret name, field value, or list field contents.

parameters.name: filter.secretTemplateIds
parameters.description: If not null or empty, returns only secrets matching the specified templates.

parameters.name: filter.siteId
parameters.description: If not null, returns only secrets within a the specified site.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip before taking results

parameters.name: sortBy[0].priority
parameters.description: Priority index. Sorts with lower values are executed earlier

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to include in results

BearerToken.description: Perform a POST request to `/oauth2/token`. It should include three form data parameters - `username`, `password`, and `grant_type`.The `grant_type` parameter should always have the value `password`.The access token returned should be included in the header of subsequent requests, like 'Authorization: Bearer token'. The token remains valid for a time period returned in the 'expires_in' property (in seconds). For details, see the token request documentation.

active.description: Active status of the Identity Provider. Users can only log-in via an active Identity Provider.

authnContext.description: When specified, instructs the IDP on how to authenticate the user(optional).

clockSkew.description: The allowed number of minutes of difference between Secret Server's clock and the IDP's clock.  The default is 3 minutes.

disableAssertionReplayCheck.description: When true, SAML messages that were already received from this IDP will be allowed by Secret Server.  Otherwise, resending messages from the IDP will trigger an error.

disableAudienceRestrictionCheck.description: A SAML assertion may include an audience restriction URI. This identifies the intended recipient of the SAML assertion. If included it should match the service provider's name.  When this setting is true, this check is skipped.

disableAuthnContextCheck.description: Disables the authentication context check, which validates that the real authentication method matches the ExpectedAuthnContext method.

disableDestinationCheck.description: When true, the destination URI in the SAML response will not be validated.

disableInboundLogout.description: When true, logout requests coming from this IDP are ignored.

disableInResponseToCheck.description: When true, the InResponseTo attribute in SAML messages is not checked.

disablePendingLogoutCheck.description: When true, a SAML logout response will be considered legitimate even if there was no corresponding logout request.

disableRecipientCheck.description: When true, the built-in check against the AssertionConsumerService URL will be skipped.

disableTimePeriodCheck.description: When true, a SAML response is valid regardless of when it was sent.

displayName.description: The Display Name for the Identity Provider.

domainAttribute.description: Optional AttributeName to use for matching a Secret Server user's domain.

enableDetailedLog.description: When true, a more detailed log will be generated for SAML logins and logouts.

enableSLO.description: When true, logging out of Secret Server will log the user out of this Identity Provider.

forceAuthentication.description: When true, the Identity Provider will be instructed to re-authenticate the user, even if they are already authenticated.

overridePendingAuthnRequest.description: When true, an in-progress SP-initiated login may be interrupted by an IDP-initiated login.

publicCertificate.description: The public certificate for the Identity Provider. Base64 encoded

signAuthnRequest.description: When true, the authentication requests sent to this IDP will be signed.

signLogoutRequest.description: When true, logout requests sent to this IDP will be signed.<

signLogoutResponse.description: When true, logout responses sent to this IDP will be signed.

singleLogoutServiceResponseUrl.description: The URL where Secret Server will send responses to single logout messages.

singleLogoutServiceUrl.description: The URL to send the single logout message to.

ssoServiceBinding.description: Method for communicating with the Identity Provider.  HTTPRedirect is recommended in most cases.

ssoServiceUrl.description: The URL of the Identity Provider where the user will be sent to authenticate.

usernameAttribute.description: Optional AttributeName to use for matching a Secret Server user.

wantAssertionEncrypted.description: When true, Secret Server will expect SAML assertions from this IDP to be encrypted. Unencrypted assertions or assertions that cannot be decrypted will cause an error.

wantAssertionOrResponseSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect either SAML assertions or SAML responses from this IDP to be signed. Unsigned assertions/responses and assertions/responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantAssertionSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect SAML assertions from this IDP to be signed. Unsigned assertions or assertions whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantLogoutRequestSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect logout requests from this IDP to be signed.  Unsigned responses or responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantLogoutResponseSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect logout responses from this IDP to be signed.  Unsigned responses or responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantSAMLResponseSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect SAML responses from this IDP to be signed. Unsigned responses or responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

success.description: Whether or not the call to Delete was successful

enableLocalUserPasswordExpiration.description: Indicates whether or not local users must change their password when it is reset or expires.

enableMinimumPasswordAge.description: Local users cannot change their password until it meets this age

enablePasswordHistory.description: Passwords cannot be reused when enabled and still in stored history

allowRememberMe.description: This option enables the "Remember Me" checkbox on the login screen.  When a user chooses to use "Remember Me", an encrypted cookie will be set in their browser.  This will enable the user to revisit Secret Server without the need to log in.  This cookie will no longer be valid when the "Remember Me" period has expired and they will have to log in again

cacheADCredentials.description: Allows cached credentials to be used when Distributed Engine is unable to connect to Active Directory

enableDomainSelector.description: Display the domain selector at login

enableLoginFailureCAPTCHA.description: When this option is checked, the user will only have to complete a CAPTCHA if their login credentials are entered incorrectly a certain number of times

maximumLoginFailures.description: Set the number of login attempts allowed before a user is locked out of their account.  Once locked out, they will need a Secret Server administrator to reset their password and enable their account

rememberMeTimeOutMinutes.description: The number of minutes that you will be remembered

userLockoutTimeMinutes.description: Number of minutes a User will be locked out for

visualEncryptedKeyboardEnabled.description: Enable the Visual Keyboard for logins

visualEncryptedKeyboardRequired.description: Require the Visual Keyboard for logins

authenticationMethod.description: Require password only, public key only, password or public key, password and public key

enable.description: When activated, SSH key pairs can be used for authentication in SSH Terminal

expirationInHours.description: The number of days and hours the key will stay active

keyExpires.description: When activated, SSH keys will expire after a specified amount of time

twoFactorBypass.description: When activated, providing a valid SSH key (and password, if required by Unix Authentication Method) will bypass any required 2FA validation

allowTwoFactorRememberMe.description: When this option is checked, the user will only have to provide their two factor authentication information once in that browser for set time. This is done by setting an encrypted cookie on the browser.  The cookie will no longer be valid when the Two Factor Remember Me Duration has expired

requireTwoFactorForWebLogin.description: Require Two Factor For Web Login

requireTwoFactorForWebServices.description: Require Two Factor For Web Services

twoFactorRememberMeTimeOutDays.description: The number of days that you will not be reprompted for 2FA

ConfigurationLoginTwoFactorOpenIdConnect.description: OpenID Connect Two Factor Login Configuration

addNewUsersToThycoticOne.description: When activated, new Secret Server users will be added automatically to Thycotic One

clientSecret.description: Client Secret, will only be populated for export, otherwise null

clientSecretExists.description: Indicates if a Client Secret exists, since the Client Secret will only be populated for export

logoutUrl.description: The URL users must visit to log out of their OpenID Connect account. (Optional)

useThycoticOneAuthAsDefault.description: When activated, passwords will be checked against Thycotic One instead of Secret Server. This affects the REST API, DoubleLock, and export functionality

attemptUserPassword.description:
If checked, Secret Server will automatically try to authenticate to RADIUS using the user's local password after it is entered during login.
If RADIUS authentication fails, the user will be prompted for the correct RADIUS password.Please note that this is not supported when Integrated Windows
Authentication is enabled

enable.description: Enabling RADIUS integration will allow another form of two factor authentication for users

enableFailoverServer.description: Enabling a Failover RADIUS server will allow another server to fail over to

enableRadiusNasId.description: Configure the NAS-Identifier that will be sent with the RADIUS Access-Request

failoverServerIP.description: The IP address of your Failover RADIUS server

sharedSecret.description: RADIUS Shared Secret for All Users

allowViewUserToRetrieveAutoChangeNextPas.description: Users that only have secret view can see the next password

DefaultSecretPermissionsType.description: Default permissions to be applied when a Secret is created

protocolHandlerInstallTimeSettingsEnable.description: Enable Protocol Handler Install Time Settings

allowWebServiceHttpGet.description: Allows the Http Get verb for Web Services.  This allows REST-style calls to many Web Service methods, but reduces security

auditTlsErrors.description: When enabled, this setting will add audits for TLS certificate validation. Auditing will apply to all Active Directory domains using LDAPS and Syslog using TLS. Certificate policy options including ignoring certificate revocation failures applies to Syslog using TLS only. The default is the most strict so the certificate chain policy may need to be updated. TLS errors will be logged to Security Audit Log found on the Administration page

auditTlsErrorsDebug.description: Enable TLS Debugging and Connection Tracking

databaseIntegrityMonitoringSymmetricKey.description: The secure symmetric key to use when sending data to the separate Database Integrity Monitoring service. This can be retrieved from the configuration utility in the Database Integrity Monitoring service install location

enableDatabaseIntegrityMonitoring.description: When enabled, Secret Server will communicate with the separately installed Database Integrity Monitoring service.  This service will send email alerts if it detects possible database tampering.  Access to Secret Server's database and web servers should be restricted to highly trusted individuals only

enableFileRestrictions.description: Enable restrictions on the types or sizes of files that can be uploaded into Secret Server

fipsEnabled.description: Allow only FIPS compliant encryption schemes to be used

forceHttps.description: By requiring HTTPS, users will not be able to access Secret Server using HTTP

hideVersionNumber.description: This will disable the VersionGet SOAP call. It will also hide the Secret Server Version Numbers from the Headers and Footer

ignoreCertificateRevocationFailures.description: Indicates if X509RevocationMode.NoCheck certificate chain policy option is set

maximumFileSizeSupported.description: Maximum File Size supported by ASP.NET

secretEraseWorkflow.description: The workflow used by secret erase

webPasswordFillerRequiresFullDomainMatch.description: When enabled, the Web Password Filler will only allow exact domain matches.  When disabled, subdomains such as https://sub.google.com will match http://google.com Secrets.  The recommended setting is enabled.

allowAutoComplete.description: Deprecated: AutoComplete is a feature provided by most web browsers to automatically remember and prefill forms for you.  This can be a great security concern since they typically do not save the data in a secure manner.  You can enable or disable web browser prefill on the Login screen by using this option. Will always return true.

allowRememberMe.description: This option enables the "Remember Me" checkbox on the login screen.  When a user chooses to use "Remember Me", an encrypted cookie will be set in their browser.  This will enable the user to revisit Secret Server without the need to log in.  This cookie will no longer be valid when the "Remember Me" period has expired and they will have to log in again

cacheADCredentials.description: Allows cached credentials to be used when Distributed Engine is unable to connect to Active Directory

maximumLoginFailures.description: Set the number of login attempts allowed before a user is locked out of their account.  Once locked out, they will need a Secret Server administrator to reset their password and enable their account

rememberMeTimeOutMinutes.description: The number of minutes that you will be remembered

userLockoutTimeMinutes.description: Number of minutes a User will be locked out for

active.description: Active status of the Identity Provider. Users can only log-in via an active Identity Provider.

authnContext.description: When specified, instructs the IDP on how to authenticate the user(optional).

clockSkew.description: The allowed number of minutes of difference between Secret Server's clock and the IDP's clock.  The default is 3 minutes.

disableAssertionReplayCheck.description: When true, SAML messages that were already received from this IDP will be allowed by Secret Server.  Otherwise, resending messages from the IDP will trigger an error.

disableAudienceRestrictionCheck.description: A SAML assertion may include an audience restriction URI. This identifies the intended recipient of the SAML assertion. If included it should match the service provider's name.  When this setting is true, this check is skipped.

disableAuthnContextCheck.description: Disables the authentication context check, which validates that the real authentication method matches the ExpectedAuthnContext method.

disableDestinationCheck.description: When true, the destination URI in the SAML response will not be validated.

disableInboundLogout.description: When true, logout requests coming from this IDP are ignored.

disableInResponseToCheck.description: When true, the InResponseTo attribute in SAML messages is not checked.

disablePendingLogoutCheck.description: When true, a SAML logout response will be considered legitimate even if there was no corresponding logout request.

disableRecipientCheck.description: When true, the built-in check against the AssertionConsumerService URL will be skipped.

disableTimePeriodCheck.description: When true, a SAML response is valid regardless of when it was sent.

displayName.description: The Display Name for the Identity Provider.

domainAttribute.description: Optional AttributeName to use for matching a Secret Server user's domain.

enableDetailedLog.description: When true, a more detailed log will be generated for SAML logins and logouts.

enableSLO.description: When true, logging out of Secret Server will log the user out of this Identity Provider.

forceAuthentication.description: When true, the Identity Provider will be instructed to re-authenticate the user, even if they are already authenticated.

overridePendingAuthnRequest.description: When true, an in-progress SP-initiated login may be interrupted by an IDP-initiated login.

publicCertificate.description: The public certificate for the Identity Provider. Base64 encoded

signAuthnRequest.description: When true, the authentication requests sent to this IDP will be signed.

signLogoutRequest.description: When true, logout requests sent to this IDP will be signed.<

signLogoutResponse.description: When true, logout responses sent to this IDP will be signed.

singleLogoutServiceResponseUrl.description: The URL where Secret Server will send responses to single logout messages.

singleLogoutServiceUrl.description: The URL to send the single logout message to.

ssoServiceBinding.description: Method for communicating with the Identity Provider.  HTTPRedirect is recommended in most cases.

ssoServiceUrl.description: The URL of the Identity Provider where the user will be sent to authenticate.

usernameAttribute.description: Optional AttributeName to use for matching a Secret Server user.

wantAssertionEncrypted.description: When true, Secret Server will expect SAML assertions from this IDP to be encrypted. Unencrypted assertions or assertions that cannot be decrypted will cause an error.

wantAssertionOrResponseSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect either SAML assertions or SAML responses from this IDP to be signed. Unsigned assertions/responses and assertions/responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantAssertionSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect SAML assertions from this IDP to be signed. Unsigned assertions or assertions whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantLogoutRequestSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect logout requests from this IDP to be signed.  Unsigned responses or responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantLogoutResponseSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect logout responses from this IDP to be signed.  Unsigned responses or responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

wantSAMLResponseSigned.description: When true, Secret Server will expect SAML responses from this IDP to be signed. Unsigned responses or responses whose signatures cannot be verified will cause an error.

If field MetadataFieldId is passed or a field already exists with the passed MetadataFieldName this is ignored. metadataFieldSectionRequiresAdministerMe.description: When the field section ID is not know this will create a field section with this setting as to whether the Administer Metadata permission is required for edit.  If MetadataFieldSectionId is passed or a section with the name MetadataFieldSectionName, this field is ignored.

metadataFieldSectionRequiresEntityEdit.description: When the field section ID is not know this will create a field section with this setting as to whether edit permission is required for edit. Otherwise view will be required.  If MetadataFieldSectionId is passed or a section with the name MetadataFieldSectionName, this field is ignored.

connectAsCommand.description: This command is used after a PuTTy session is launched on a Secret that has SSH Proxy enabled and has a Secret set under 'Connect As' in the Launcher tab. The default su command is 'su - $USERNAME'. $USERNAME is the token used to retrieve the username field from the Secret. Sudo can also be used by specifying 'sudo -u $USERNAME /bin/bash'.

connectAsCommandResponse.description: The Connect As Command Response is the response from the server prompting for a password. This is used so $productName knows when to send the password to the system. If the response from the server after typing 'su - root' is 'Password:' then the Connect As Command Response needs to contain 'Password:$PASSWORD'. The $CONNECTASPASSWORD token will use the credentials from the Secret set under 'Connect As' when prompted.

restrictUserInput.description: You may specify a field of comma separated hosts or IP addresses that the user will be restricted to. The allow list will allow only these values, while the block list will allow all values except the hosts on the Secret Field.  Example: 192.168.1.2, MACHINE.EXAMPLE.COM, 192.168.1.60
